meta._et_pb_old_content:
A & A Search and ClinLab Staffing offer exciting career opportunities. Below is a list of some of our current opportunities. If you are interested in one of the following positions, simply submit your resume online.

[jobs]

General IT Positions

Front End User Interface Web Developer

Job Description:
As a Software Engineer, Front-End you will be responsible for developing core user interface functionality for our web platform and applications.

Requirements:
1. 4+ years of experience in front-end development.
2. BS in computer science or engineering.
3. Must have:

  • Expert knowledge of web technologies (HTML/CSS/JS). We use HTML5, SASS, Compass, Backbone.js, jQuery.
  • Experience developing with a templating engine, both server side (we use Twig) and client side (we use Underscore.js).
  • Knowledge of PHP, ability to dive in when necessary, Symfony2 experience a plus.
  • Ability to communicate effectively across multiple departments.
  • Passion for elegance in the UX, pixel perfection, and getting the details right.
  • Ability to write well-abstracted, reusable code.
  • Familiar with development on OS X/Linux, Version control with Git, and general best practices.

4. Must be a strong contributor who drives innovation while having a good time with a great team.
5. Must be a results-oriented, self-motivated creative team player who is driven to come up with great solutions to our problems.

Java Software Engineer

Major areas of responsibility include:

  • Design and code components of our client's management server.
  • Independently pursue challenging technical problems with only occasional assistance and guidance.
  • Collaborate with other engineers both on the same and different teams.
  • Develop unit and system tests, integrate into automated test infrastructure.
  • Investigate and resolve customer problems.
  • Enhance and maintain the build infrastructure.
  • Follow coding standards and best practices for code management.
  • Document issues and solutions accurately and clearly.
  • Update job knowledge continuously by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; participating in professional organizations.

Job Qualifications:

  • A solid foundation in computer science.
  • Server-side experience with threading, concurrency and synchronization techniques.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Programming experience in Java, C# or C++ (strong OO skills preferred).
  • Experience using software development IDEs such as Eclipse or Microsoft Visual Studio.
  • Working knowledge of either Windows or Linux operating systems.
  • Ability to work well with members of cross-functional teams.
  • Well organized and possess outstanding attention to detail.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with frequent software releases.The following experiences would be highly desirable:
  • Web applications or GUI development
  • Google Web Toolkit (GWT)
  • Object-relational mapping frameworks (Hibernate)
  • Web-service or REST API development
  • Authentication of devices, including public-key infrastructure (PKI)
  • Web server platforms (Apache/Tomcat, IIS, J2EE)
  • Web network protocols (HTTP/S)
  • Database programming (MS SQL)
  • Agile software development methodology

Education and Experience:

  • BA/BS Computer Science or equivalent required

Sr. Linux System Administrator

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for maintaining our 24x7x365 Software-as-a-Service platform, including Production, Dev/QA, and Disaster Recovery environments
  • Configure and tune SaaS infrastructure for performance and availability
  • Monitor systems and plan for future capacity and scaling
  • Participate in architectural and design efforts for systems and application platforms
  • Provide escalation point for customer-based Application Support issues
  • Provide Information Protection management, including backups and replication administration
  • Create and maintain documentation on processes and procedures.
  • Participate in an on-call rotation
  • Implement key automation tools for streamlining workflow and systems management
  • Work collaboratively with development, QA and other administrators to develop and implement improved deployment practices.Work with the Business Continuity Team to refine and test disaster recovery systems and procedures.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of UNIX/Linux systems administration in large environments supporting highly available, customer-facing services (RHEL/OEL are a plus)
  • Deep understanding of Linux internals, including kernel and tcp stack tuning
  • Extensive experience with the following applications: Apache 2.x and Jboss 4.x as well as Ruby on Rails, MySQL 5.x+ and MongoDB (a plus)
  • Proficient in at least one scripting language (perl, bash, ksh, Python)
  • Experience scaling web applications in a highly available environment (OS, db, application and web tier clustering)
  • Hands on experience with Configuration Management platforms such as Puppet (preferred) and Chef
  • Experience optimizing and tuning the Java Virtual Machine in a high volume production environment.
  • Experience with SNMP monitoring using tools similar to Cacti, Nagios (preferred), or Groundwork
  • In-depth knowledge of iSCSI-based storage area networks
  • Virtual Infrastructure experience (VMware preferred)
  • Solid understanding of programming and software development to the level necessary to interface with and guide software development groups from a systems and infrastructure perspective
  • Solid understanding of core networking concepts (TCP/IP, DNS, Routing, LDAP, VLAN/Network segmentation, VPN, Firewall management, S/FTP)
  • Exposure to, and knowledge of, Information and Network Security concepts such as log aggregation, IPS/IDS, as well as vulnerability scanning and assessment
  • Must be a self-starter with the ability to multitask, work independently, as well as positively participate on a team
  • Experience supporting 24x7 critical systems in B2B and B2C
  • Experience working in agile environment with frequent software releases is desired
  • Bachelor’s Degree in CS in or related field

Help Desk Technician

Broad range of network and desktop knowledge is highly desirable, including experience in:

  • Desktop: Windows 2000, XP & Vista Microsoft Office 97-2007 Outlook & Exchange configurations, McAfee & Symantec anti-virus
  • OS: Microsoft Windows 2000, XP &Vista and Macintosh
  • Hardware: Dell Optiplex desktops & Latitude laptops and Dell & HP printers
  • Protocols: TCP/IP, IPX, AppleTalk, Ethernet
  • Technologies: SMS, Remote Desktop/Assistance, Citrix, ODBC, VPN, application security, and major clinical IT applications

Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline
  • Microsoft Active Directory & XP pro certified
  • CompTIA A+, Security+ are helpful
  • Technical proficiency in a broad range of technical hardware and software
  • Demonstrated knowledge of current PC computing technology
  • Familiarity with Windows Active Directory LAN environments
  •  Knowledge of ITIL best practices is also desirable

IT Financial Positions

.Net Developer

Position Purpose:
As a Senior .Net Developer, you will be a critical part of the services that the company provides worldwide. This position will be responsible for the design and development of new applications as well as enhancing and maturing our existing code base. You will participate in the full SDLC, will mentor and train junior developers in best-practice development methodology and will establish and enforce code and design standards.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Participate in solution design, concept visualization and functional and technical requirements definition and documentation.
  • Coordinate cross-functional design discussions and ensure that all stakeholders, both internal and external to IT understand the impacts and effects of design decisions.
  • Analyze business requirements to create relevant deliverables, suggest enhancements and provide feedback on best-practice implementation.
  • Create and execute unit tests to ensure requirements are met and coding standards and guidelines are followed.
  • Act as a mentor to other developers: provide guidance in industry best practices, conduct code and design reviews and advise on training and knowledge improvement opportunities.
  • Assist in the development and documentation of technical specifications including database and application architecture and design.
  • Work with business users and project managers to understand inefficiencies in existing business applications and recommend solutions.
  • Develop across all layers of applications, using the Microsoft technology stack, including C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server (SSIS/SSRS), Silverlight, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
  • Champion process improvements fostering ownership and empowerment across the project teams, IT and the organization.
  • Communicate technical integration decisions and plans to project team and business partners.
  • Work with project managers to facilitate an understanding of deliverables, timing estimates and prioritization decisions.

Desired Minimum Qualifications:

Education and Experience:

  • Requires a Bachelor’s degree in a related area; master’s degree a strong plus
  • 5+ years of development experience with OO programming languages
  • Experience with various SDLC methodologies, Agile, Waterfall, RAD, Scrum etc.
  • Database design and development experience with Microsoft SQL Server
  • Preferred experience in working with a Microsoft-based technology stack
  • Experience with healthcare, insurance, and/or financial data systems a strong plus

Necessary Knowledge:

  • Test driven development
  • Multi-tier development and design paradigms
  • Standard software development patterns and practices
  • Microsoft TFS / Team Suite development environments
  • Commitment to deadlines
  • Task estimation and risk assessment skills
  • Willingness to meet the needs of 24x7 environment
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Creative and can think outside of the box
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Excellent Customer service skills
  • Excellent Vendor relationship management skills
  • Must be detail oriented, ability to multi-task

Applications Architect

The company is looking for an experienced developer who demonstrates a high degree of technical knowledge and motivation to join our growing eBusiness team. You would be joining an energetic team of developers who are responsible for building new robust, scalable web applications, as well as improve existing applications in support of our external web presence at the company website. Strong programming skills, deep knowledge of the Microsoft .NET Framework and ASP.NET, as well as demonstrated experience with Microsoft SQL Server are a must.The ability to quickly learn and implement new emerging technologies will further contribute to success in this position.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Work with business and program management team to gather, refine and document specifications
  • Responsible for managing team of development resources
  • Establish proper application performance and efficiency guidelines, the development team in achieving them.
  • Architect, and lead the develop of robust and well-performing applications in support of business objectives
  • Collaborate closely with business groups, IT development teams, and system administration team to ensure successful implementation of each solution.
  • Consider and research emerging technologies to improve current applications, architectures and processes
  • Become knowledgeable on existing web applications, debug issues and improve performance where necessary
  • Be able to work with minimal guidance

Qualifications

Experience:

  • 6+ years of proven success as a senior level web developer required
  • Proficient in C#/MVC, ASP.NET 2.0 and later, Ajax, CSS, Javascript, HTML technologies
  • Experience with SOA, Web services (WCF), JavaScript MVC
  • Experience with CSS, Jquery or other javascript libraries
  • Knowledge of IIS and ASP.NET is a must
  • SQL Server Database experience – 2008/2012 a plus
  • Thorough knowledge of various SDLC methodologies
  • Strong object oriented design skills and software architecture skills
  • Understanding of, and experience with ORM concepts and technologies
  • Experience with high-volume web applications
  • Demonstrated proficiency of troubleshooting techniques and detail-oriented problem diagnosis
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills a must
  • Knowledge of UML
  • 2+ years managing development team

Additional Desired Skills:
• Experience with global application deployments over CDNs
• Exposure and knowledge of EE, and circuit components and design concepts
• Experience with Agile development methodology is a plus

Education Level
• Master's Degree (±18 years)

QA Engineer

As Mid-level Software Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be a critical part of the services that we provide worldwide. This position will be responsible for assisting the Development team with the design and execution of test plans for new and existing application solutions.

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities:

  • Actively test/validate/verify all areas of supported API and Web Services projects, to ensure highest possible quality deliverables.
  • Develop, execute, and maintain Test Plans/Test Cases/Automated Test Scripts within an Agile SDLC from business and technical requirements.
  • Contribute to the Automation of SQA Engineering team activities.
  • Assist in troubleshooting environment and configuration issues during releases.
  • Work closely with the Release Manager to deliver high quality software to staging and production environments.
  • Assist in the development and documentation of technical specifications that support the SQA testing process.

Desired Minimum Qualifications:
Education and Experience:

  • Requires an Associate’s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science area; Bachelor’s degree is a strong plus.
  • 4+ years of Software QA experience testing multi-tier web applications.
  • 4+ year of using Software QA testing automation tools, especially for Load Testing, Stress Testing, and Performance Monitoring
  • Experience with the following is a strong plus:
    • API testing and REST/SOAP Web Services testing
    • SOAP UI
    • T-SQL, SQL/RDMS and SSMS, SSIS, SSRS
    • Query plans, Query Analysis
    • Error handling techniques
    • Test driven development
    • Development/maintenance of Test Jigs and Test Harnesses
    • Coded Unit Test in framework using JUnit or NUnit
  • Experience with the following is very desirable:
    • Data Integration + Data Transformation testing
    • SQL Server
    • ETL processes testing using ETL tools such as SQL Server Integration Services
    • Crystal Reports or Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services
  • Exposure to various SDLC methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, RAD, Scrum, etc.
  • Experience with healthcare, insurance, and/or financial applications is a strong plus

Necessary Knowledge:

  • Software QA testing management (use of testing tools and methodologies)
  • Commitment to deadlines and ability to work under constraints
  • Willingness to meet the needs of 24x7 environment
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Creative and can think outside of the box
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills
  • Excellent Customer Service skills
  • Must be detail-oriented, ability to multi-task
  • Team-oriented, highly motivated, and self-starting

Web Applications Developer

Description:
This position requires a high degree of technical knowledge, motivation, to become part of an energetic team of developers and contribute to building new robust, scalable web applications, as well as improve existing applications that support our external web presence at www.analog.com. Experience with the .NET programming language and some real-world programming experience as well as SQL and general database design/development experience is required.
The ability to quickly learn and implement new emerging technologies will further contribute to success in this position.Essential Responsibilities:
  • Work with business and program management team to clarify and document specifications
  • Under the supervision of Senior developers within the team, develop and verify performance and functionality of web applications
  • Perform unit and load tests against each solution to ensure proper performance and efficiency guidelines are met
  • Collaborate closely with business groups, IT development teams, and system administration team to ensure successful implementation of each solution

Qualifications

Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent relevant experience
  • Minimum 3 years demonstrable success as a .NET web developer
  • Understanding of OOP, MVC, ORM concepts
  • Experience with Javascript, AJAX, Jquery or other javascript libraries
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and related technologies
  • Database experience (MS SQL in particular) is required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Additional Desired Skills:

  • Experience in presentation layer using CSS/JS and HTML
  • Knowledge of SDLC methodologies
  • Knowledge of UML is a plus

Education Level

  • Bachelor's Degree (±16 years)

ClinLab Staffing- Pre-clinical

QA Compliance Associate

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and implement internal audit program
  • Perform internal audits on a monthly basis
  • Issue internal audit reports and follow-up to resolution
  • May assist in external audits
  • Deliver and track GMP training to new hires and current employees
  • Create training curriculum binders
Technical Knowledge:
Demonstrated knowledge of relevant laws, legal codes, government regulations and agency rules. This includes the understanding of cGMP requirements, EU Regulations, GXP regulations and current industry practices.

Analytical Associate III

The temporary Analytical Associate is expected to develop release, in-process and characterization assays for the analysis of antibodies, conjugated antibodies and small molecule intermediates. Qualify/transfer assays to QC, PSE, CMOs or external partners. Participate in formulation development activates by preparing and analyzing stability samples.

Essential Functions:

  • Primary duties will be related to the analysis of antibodies, conjugates, and small molecules by using high-performance liquid chromatography (e.g.: SEC, IEX, RP-HPLC), electrophoretic methods (e.g.: gel-chip, capillary electrophoresis) and UV spectroscopy
  • Measurement of pH, osmolality, conductivity, and density of solutions (e.g.: conjugate sample, formulation buffer components)
  • Writing of technical documents (e.g.: development report, draft SOPs, etc.)
  • The Analytical Associate III is expected to work independently with limited supervision

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BS 4-6 years or M.S. with 2-4 years of experience with protein, carbohydrate, or small molecule analysis.
  • Expertise with liquid chromatography and UV spectroscopy is required.
  • Familiarity with capillary electrophoresis is desirable.

Sr./Lead Manufacturing Associate

Key Responsibilities:

  • Performs routine manufacturing operations for the production of clinical and/or commercial products.
  • Operates production equipment according to SOPs.
  • Performs manufacturing activities of full scope, including but not limited to work functions in Cell Culture, Purification, Solution, & Equipment Prep Areas.
  • Will write and edit SOPs
  • Performs maintenance of production equipment.
  • Maintains records and clean room environment to comply with regulatory requirements, GMPs, and SOPs.
  • Review and execute validation protocols. Will formulate and recommend improvements to manufacturing policies and programs.
  • Provide in-process testing to assure batches meet specifications.
  • Will train personnel in new and revised procedures.
  • Leads daily on-floor operations.
  • Uses ability as a skilled specialist to contribute in development of concepts and techniques, and to complete tasks in creative and effective ways.
  • Mentor less skilled support staff.
  • Make process decisions, including the trouble shooting of equipment, corrective action to process deviations.
  • Individual will be required to understand operations and contact appropriate support to ensure issues are appropriately resolved.
  • Required to offer recommendations for process and system improvements.
  • Required to identify process deviations and take immediate action to mitigate event.

Research Associate/Sr. Research Associate

Cell/Molecular Biology

Key Responsibilities:

  • Work in a team to develop ultra-sensitive assays for the detection of nucleic acids (DNA and RNA) using proprietary single molecule array (SiMoA)
  • Design and implement molecular biology strategies for detecting single NA molecules.
  • Work closely with chemists and biologists to implement these novel assays in the SiMoA detection platform.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Broad experience and knowledge of molecular biology techniques.
  • Skills and hands-on experience with molecular cloning, transformations, and cell culture.

ClinLab Staffing-Clinical

Clinical Trial Manager

The Clinical Trial Manager will independently oversee clinical studies from concept to close-out. The ideal candidate will be highly adaptable and a proactive problem-solver with the ability to critically evaluate and manage timelines and key deliverables.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Select and manage contract research organizations and other external vendors to support clinical studies
  • Independently manage study activities, including: selection of investigators, study start-up activities including site initiation, study monitoring activities, data collection and close-out activities
  • Provide oversight of the CRO to ensure compliance with the client's quality measures
  • Provide input to both the CRO and internal quality assurance plans for the study, and ensure study team adherence to the plans
  • Develop and manage study timelines
  • Contribute to the development of study related documents (contracts, ICFs, protocols, IBs, etc.)
  • Participate in development of CRFs, including User Acceptance Testing Prepare clinical study budgets and monitor budgets for variances
  • Project study enrollment and drug supply
  • Manage study drug packaging and distribution activities
  • Address and escalate relevant operational issues to key stakeholders
  • Be aware of and be able to predict deviations, or potential non-compliance concerns (at a protocol level, site level, study level) and rapidly resolve or escalate appropriately
  • Provide portfolio support across the organization

Clinical Data Manager

Skill Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred in area of specialty and 2-5 years of experience in the field or in a related area.
  • Familiar with standard concepts, practices and procedures within a particular field. Relies on limited experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • A thorough knowledge concerning Clinical Electronic Data Capture Systems (i.e. Medidata).
  • A strong background in statistics and their appropriate application to product development and manufacturing.
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate at multiple levels of the organization.
  • PC, word processing, spreadsheet and database skills.
  • Ability to organize and establish priorities and ability to generate and maintain accurate records.

Medical Writer

Key Duties:

  • Collaborates within clinical biometrics and with clinical operations, clinical science, translational medicine, regulatory affairs, and other departments as required, on the development and/or revision of protocols, protocol amendments, subject consent forms, clinical study reports, clinical sections of regulatory submission documents, Investigator’s Brochures, presentation material, etc.
  • Manages all aspects of the medical writing processes for document development including, scheduling/timeline management, driving document preparation, coordinating document reviews and revisions, maintaining version control, and coordinating final reviews and approval.
  • Represents Medical Writing and Clinical Biometrics on cross-functional teams.
  • Functions as a key medical writing contributor for clinical teams to ensure that key messages and concepts are developed and incorporated into relevant documents.
  • Contributes to the strategic development of assigned projects/programs.
  • Contributes to the development of standard processes relating to medical writing.
  • Writes, reviews and edits documents in accordance with, Federal Regulations, Good Clinical Practices and ICH guidelines and Our Client’s Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Develops, edits and reviews regulatory documents within agreed timelines that have high quality scientific content, organization, clarity, accuracy, format and consistency.
  • Stays current on medical writing best practices and regulatory guidelines. Expands knowledge/understanding of medical and scientific issues related to document development.
  • Mentors and helps to develop junior employees.

Regulatory Specialist

Key Duties:

  • Prepare and submit INDs and IND amendments and other regulatory submissions, as required. Coordinate with Clinical Research, Clinical Operations, Non-clinical Research, Manufacturing and Quality to assure timely and accurate preparation of regulatory submissions.
  • Prepare and submit NIH submissions as required.
  • Review information contained in regulatory submissions to assure accuracy and clarity.
  • Prepare and maintain regulatory submission tracking logs and files.
  • Prepare and coordinate safety reports.
  • Review of site regulatory packages and approval for drug shipments to site.
  • Work with vendors/CRO to manage preparation of eCTD and any ex-US filings.
  • Understanding and knowledge of regulatory guidelines
  • Working knowledge of gene therapy requirements a plus
  • Work with other departments to complete required activities
  • Attend meetings as regulatory designee

SAS Programmer

Job Description:The SAS Programmer will provide clinical programming support to the Clinical Development/Medical Affairs (CDMA) department and other functional areas upon request. The SAS Programmer will work independently and as part of a multifunctional team. Activities will include, but are not limited to, programming specifications, and development/validation of SAS programs and macros in support of clinical study output [tables,/listings/figures (TLFs)], ad-hoc statistical analyses, safety surveillance, and departmental standards initiatives.

  • Creates SAS programs to generate TLFs and derived datasets in collaboration with analysis plans and departmental programming guidelines
  • Performs and documents programming validation of TLF’s, and derived data sets created by other programmers and/or statisticians.
  • Performs ad-hoc programming requests as required to support CDMA programs and initiatives
  • Reviews and provides feedback on case report form designs, CRF annotations, dB structures, edit checks, and SAPs
  • Creates and maintains SAS Macros to create standard formatted output and assist with automation of routine tasks.
  • Creates and documents mapping specifications for derived datasets.
  • Take initiative to improve Cubist processes to keep current with evolving industry standards for clinical research and participate in review/development of quality systems and processes. Assist with CDISC implementation, particularly ADaM datasets and other standards initiatives.
  • Interfaces and provides direction/oversight of statistical programming work being conducted externally by CROs and/or consultants.

Experience:

    Minimum of two years programming experience with SAS in industry and/or CRO is required. Proficiency in SAS (Base/STAT/Macro) is required. Additional knowledge using SAS Graphics, SQL, EXCEL and/or JMP are preferred.

Education:

    B.S. in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related field. M.S. preferred.
